message: Hi everyone, with the upcoming Zynga deal, who's going to play catch-up? Playfish is out (MAU falling and producing weird stuff for EA, new Monopoly is good though), Playdom is stable with no surprised (and no new games), Crowdstar is somewhat quiet (after the last year rumours of MS deal). With dozens of acquisitions of mid-sized studios, who's left out there? There are few companies like Wooga in TOP20, but most of companies lost traction last year with the exception of Digital Chocolate. What are your thoughts on that subject?
It is for this reason I love the game "Molecules" on facebook

Somehow the very fact that a game tests my patience and capacity to continuously click on my touchpad is what troubles me about Social Game. Test my skills, logic and talent, not my capacity to send game requests to my friends like a spammer.
